org.nerd4j.csv.conf.mapping.ann

Annotation Type CSVColumn


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value={FIELD,METHOD})
public @interface CSVColumn
    Maps a JavaBean property to a CSV column.

    Usage

    The CSVColumn annotation can be used with the following program elements:

    • JavaBean property (getter);
    • JavaBean field.

    This annotation is equivalent to the XML configuration csv:column.

    Author:
    Nerd4j Team

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String name
      The name of the CSV column reported in the CSV source header if any, or the column index if no header is defined.
      boolean optional
      Tells if the this column is optional or mandatory in the output data model.
      CSVFieldProcessor[] readProcessor
      Definition of the processor to use to perform the conversion between the CSV column value and the data model field during reading process.
      String readProcessorRef
      The name used to refer to a previous configured field processor and use it during reading process.
      CSVFieldProcessor[] writeProcessor
      Definition of the processor to use to perform the conversion between the CSV column value and the data model field during writing process.
      String writeProcessorRef
      The name used to refer to a previous configured field processor and use it during writing process.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract String name
        The name of the CSV column reported in the CSV source header if any, or the column index if no header is defined.
        Returns:
        the column name in the header or the column index.
        Default:
        ""

      • optional

        public abstract boolean optional
        Tells if the this column is optional or mandatory in the output data model.

        An optional column means that the related data model accepts null values.

        The default value for this field is false.

        Returns:
        true if the column value is optional.
        Default:
        false

      • readProcessorRef

        public abstract String readProcessorRef
        The name used to refer to a previous configured field processor and use it during reading process.
        Returns:
        name of the referenced processor.
        Default:
        ""

      • readProcessor

        public abstract CSVFieldProcessor[] readProcessor
        Definition of the processor to use to perform the conversion between the CSV column value and the data model field during reading process.
        Returns:
        CSV field processor definition.
        Default:
        {}

      • writeProcessorRef

        public abstract String writeProcessorRef
        The name used to refer to a previous configured field processor and use it during writing process.
        Returns:
        name of the referenced processor.
        Default:
        ""

      • writeProcessor

        public abstract CSVFieldProcessor[] writeProcessor
        Definition of the processor to use to perform the conversion between the CSV column value and the data model field during writing process.
        Returns:
        CSV field processor definition.
        Default:
        {}
